I agree with Paul, the NTHK should say something about the piece 
they are =
about to 'pink slip'. My blade was given a pink slip 
without any comment a=
bout it at all. As I stated earlier, Inami 
Hakusui papered it to Shinto Su=
kesada. I have it from reliable 
sources that only Koto smiths used Bizen K=
uni Ju Osafune -. This 
prefix is Sue-Bizen. Shinto Bizen used Bizen Osafun=
e Ju -. Anyway, I 
was disappointed that the only explanation given was tha=
t they would 
not Shinsa it due to the 'temper line' running off in the kis=
saki. 
Oh well, I will bring it to next years SF Token Kai and get all 
sor=
ts of opinions.

Elliott
